result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on 11/8/22 was rescheduled along with the jury status hearing on 11/1/22.

9:47 AM Defendant Caleb A Sadowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Caleb A Sadowski.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for a global offer but would like to maintain the prompt disposition request at this time.
Due to a conflict with the court's calendar the trial dates need to be rescheduled.
Court will reschedule the trial in 22CF252.  22CF823 to tag along for further proceedings.
Jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side is entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Clerk to prepare an order to produce for 11/18/22.

8:31 AM Defendant Caleb A Sadowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis appeared by video for Caleb A Sadowski.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Randy Sitzberger sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Hirt.  Cross examination by Atty. Griffis.  Redirect.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Hirt moves for bind over.  Atty. Griffis objects to bind over and moves for case to be dismissed.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional

The Court will waive the Defendant's appearance.
Attorney Griffis states that Dodge Correctional was not able to set up a Zoom appearance, however the Defendant wants a prelim date.
The Court notes that his other case is set 9/30/22 at 9:30 am.  
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.

Bail was not addressed on the record.  Per Judge Bohren bail is to be set by the Court Commissioner at the preliminary hearing on 9/7/22.

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb A Sadowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Caleb A Sadowski.

Defense acknowledges receipt of the criminal complaint and waives further reading.
Defense requests a preliminary hearing in 2-3 weeks.
Court addresses the prompt disposition request.  Court will apply the request to both cases and all parties agree that the matters are to be resolved by 12/2/22.
Court will set 22CF252 for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side to receive 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare trial order.  Clerk to prepare an order to produce.
